Title: 42677 - # Growing Pains All New Businesses Face
Direction: 500 words. List 3-6 problems that almost businesses face when they're first starting out. Running a business can feel like problems are unique to you, when they're actually quite common. Some examples of common problems include deciding when to hire additional staff, founder fatigue from working long hours, and getting your name out there. For the client link, mention accepting credit cards as a challenge, because new businesses without a history are considered risky. Your audience is small business owners or professionals who are thinking about starting their own business.

Title: 42678 - # New Ways Businesses Are Catching Credit Card Fraud
Direction: 500 words. Almost all small businesses have to contend with fraudulent purchases at some point during their first year or two. List 3-6 ways companies can spot fraud, like overly large purchases, suspicious addresses, and daily repeat buyers. Offer solutions on ways to prevent fraud on the company. For the client link, mention that fraud purchases hurt the business and need to be prevented with regular monitoring. Your audience is growing small business owners who have been or at risk to become targets of fraud.

Title: 42679 - # Reasons Young People Are Starting Their Own Companies
Direction: 500 words. List 3-6 reasons young people are starting their own businesses instead of working for major companies. Reasons include wanting to follow their passions and be their own boss, the Internet making it easier to launch an online company, and the start-up culture making entrepreneurship more appealing. For the client link, mention the ease of getting a credit line in the section of ease of getting a website up to ship all over the world. Your audience is young people who have started their own businesses or want to.

Title: 42680 - # of the Highest Risk Industries

Your audience is interested in businesses that one can run online from anywhere in the world.
